main event: Multiple sightings of a disc-shaped, silvery-white object traveling at a high speed and low altitude in Marietta, Pennsylvania on 6 August 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including a civilian woman and a radio operator, all describing the object as a disc-shaped, silvery-white object with no sound or exhaust.
The object was described as having a bright white glow and was about half the size of the moon, traveling at a very high rate of speed and exhibiting high maneuverability.
A handwritten response described the object as appearing to be a solid, metallic, disc-like object traveling at a very rapid rate of speed.
Observational data indicated that the sighting lasted only 2-3 seconds, suggesting the object's swift movement and disappearance.
The report involved detailed questionnaires about the observers' experiences, including their location, activities, and weather conditions at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: civilian woman, radio operator, and others
photographs: no photographs available in the report
